event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A non-fatal uncorrectable internal error was detected on the DMA interface used by DSCP on a MBC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A non-fatal uncorrectable internal error was detected on the DMA interface used by DSCP on a MBC chip.

The domain may encounter an uncorrectable error, but the domain will not panic.

If there is another operation DSCP path on another XSB in the domain,
then the DSCP path will be switched to the other XSB.
Otherwise, the domain will continue to use this DSCP path.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      There is no other XSB, thus there is no alternate path.
      The platform becomes unbootable.


   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      If the fault applies to a single XSB associated with the MBC chip (this
      can be determined from the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be
      deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or the domain using the
      XSB is rebooted or the domain stops using the XSB due to a DR operation.

      If the fault applies to all XSBs associated with the MBC chip, then the domains
      will not be allowed to reboot and the system will gradually become unusable.

     If the fault applies to the entire MBC chip and not to just one XSB
     associated with the MBC (this can be determined from the FMRI of the
     ereport or the ASRU of the fault), then DSCP will be switched to some
     other DSCP path for all the XSBs associated with this MBC chip.


    SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      If the fault applies to a single XSB associated with the MBC chip (this
      can be determined from the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be
      deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or the domain using the
      XSB is rebooted or the domain stops using the XSB due to a DR operation.

      If the fault applies to all XSBs associated with the MBC chip, then the domains
      will not be allowed to reboot and the system will gradually become unusable.

     If the fault applies to the entire MBC chip and not to just one XSB
     associated with the MBC (this can be determined from the FMRI of the
     ereport or the ASRU of the fault), then DSCP will be switched to some
     other DSCP path for all the XSBs associated with this MBC chip.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platform:

      If the fault applies to a single XSB associated with the MBC chip (this
      can be determined from the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be
      deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or the domain using the
      XSB is rebooted or the domain stops using the XSB due to a DR operation.

      If the fault applies to all XSBs associated with the MBC chip, then the CMU
      with the MBC chip will gradually be deconfigured and domains will  not be allowed
      to use XSBs on this CMU, as domains reboot or domains stop using the XSBs
      due to DR operations.

     If the fault applies to the entire MBC chip and not to just one XSB
     associated with the MBC (this can be determined from the FMRI of the
     ereport or the ASRU of the fault), then DSCP will be switched to some
     other DSCP path for all the XSBs associated with this MBC chip.

 


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:22:51 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 6a958635-ff42-497c-844c-9d91b3018856
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8003-NY for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8003-NY, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:22:51 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 6a958635-ff42-497c-844c-9d91b3018856
   DESC: A non-fatal uncorrectable internal error was detected on the DMA interface used by DSCP
   on a MBC chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-NY for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: DSCP will switch to use some other XSB's DMA interface, if there is an operational DMA interface
   on another XSB in this domain. Otherwise, the system will continue to use the existing DMA interface.
   The XSB with this DMA interface will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
   after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The domain may encounter an uncorrectable error, but the domain will not panic.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 6a958635-ff42-497c-844c-9d91b3018856

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:22:51.8714 6a958635-ff42-497c-844c-9d91b3018856 SCF-8003-NY
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.mbc.se-dma-dscp

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mbc=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/xsb=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain may encounter an uncorrectable error, but the domain will not panic.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: DSCP will switch to use some other XSB's DMA interface, if there is an operational DMA interface on another XSB in this domain. Otherwise, the system will continue to use the existing DMA interface. The XSB with this DMA interface will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Non-fatal uncorrectable error detected on a MBC chip.
